fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus asked Jesus, "How can someone be born again when they are already old? Can they go back into their mom's tummy to be born?" Jesus replied, "Listen carefully! This new life is all about trusting in Jesus to save us!"

fresh_translation.text: When a baby is born, they come from their mom, which is physical birth. But when someone believes in Jesus, they have a special spiritual birth through God's Spirit. For God, who said, 'Let light shine out of darkness,' made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ.

translation_notes: I want to make sure that the updated translation keeps the original message but makes it simpler for a seven-year-old to understand. I will focus on the concepts of light and darkness, avoiding vague phrases while being more direct about the consequences of choices. I need to maintain clarity about God's love and the nature of sin while ensuring it fits well with the message from JHN 3:18.

fresh_translation.text: Here’s what’s important: God sent Jesus to be a bright light that helps us know how to do good things. But some people choose to do bad things and stay in the dark, which means they are far away from God. When they turn away from the light, they aren’t able to feel God's love and happiness. This choice is serious, and it means they are not living the way God wants them to live.

source: αὕτη δέ ἐστιν ἡ κρίσις, ὅτι τὸ φῶς ἐλήλυθεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον, καὶ ἠγάπησαν οἱ ἄνθρωποι μᾶλλον τὸ σκότος ἢ τὸ φῶς· ἦν γὰρ πονηρὰ αὐτῶν τὰ ἔργα.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
If we say we have fellowship with him while we walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth.
But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know over what they stumble.
Therefore be careful lest the light in you be darkness.

translation_notes: The goal is to refine the translation by using clearer language while emphasizing the consequences of choosing darkness over light, in a way that a seven-year-old can understand. I will simplify concepts and focus on making the distinction between light and darkness more apparent, while also retaining the key theological themes.

fresh_translation.text: Some people choose to do bad things, and they run away from God’s light because they are scared of getting in trouble. But God’s light is here to show us His love and help us make better choices. When we stay in the dark, we miss out on feeling God's happiness and love. God really wants us to come into His light, tell Him when we’ve made mistakes, and let Him help us do what is right.

source: πᾶς γὰρ ὁ φαῦλα πράσσων μισεῖ τὸ φῶς καὶ οὐκ ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα μὴ ἐλεγχθῇ τὰ ἔργα αὐτοῦ·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse is closely related to the previous one, as it contrasts the actions of those who do wrong with those who seek to do right. However, it can still stand alone with its meaning intact.

related_verses.text: Jesus spoke to them, saying, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life."
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.

translation_notes: I will revise the translation to ensure it emphasizes the relationship between truth and coming to God’s light, while maintaining simplicity and clarity for a seven-year-old. I will avoid suggesting that good actions are merely a display of love, instead emphasizing genuine connection with God. Additionally, I'll ensure that the connection to God's influence in our actions is clear, in line with the previous verse about honesty and light.

fresh_translation.text: But when people are honest and do what is right, they come into God’s light. This helps others see that their good choices come from God and shows that they really want to follow Him.

source: ὁ δὲ ποιῶν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα φανερωθῇ αὐτοῦ τὰ ἔργα, ὅτι ἐν Θεῷ ἐστιν εἰργασμένα.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in these verses flow well together, but they do not require rearranging or merging into one verse.

I will clarify the meaning of baptism, emphasize Jesus' authority and His teachings more explicitly, and ensure that the language remains simple and relatable for a seven-year-old. I will also replace 'mistakes' with 'wrong choices' to enhance clarity. Overall, I want to maintain the essence of the message while ensuring theological accuracy and age-appropriate language.

fresh_translation.text: After that, Jesus and His followers went to Judea. There, Jesus taught the people about God and how to love each other. He baptized people in water to show they were sorry for their wrong choices and wanted to follow Him as their Lord. This baptism was a special way for them to join God's family, showing they were committed to living in the way God wants us to live.

source: Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβε μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
This water symbolizes baptism that now saves you also—not the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a clear conscience toward God.

translation_notes: To enhance clarity and comprehension for a seven-year-old, I will focus on incorporating the idea of repentance in relation to baptism while maintaining a direct connection to Jesus. Additionally, I will ensure that the concept of John the Baptist is briefly contextualized for deeper understanding. I will simplify phrases where possible without losing essential theological meanings. My aim is to provide a coherent and engaging paraphrase that communicates the importance of baptism as both an expression of faith and a commitment to follow Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: At that same time, John the Baptist was baptizing people at a place called Aenon, near Salim, where there was lots of water. Many people came to him because they wanted to show they were sorry for their wrong choices and needed a fresh start with God. Baptism was a special way for them to say, 'I love God and want to follow Jesus!' John was helping them promise to follow God and be part of His family, just like Jesus was teaching.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John's friends came to him and said, "Teacher, do you remember that special man you told us about? That's Jesus! It's a way to say they're sorry for their mistakes and want to start fresh with God!"
